awd_abstract_narration: This award is made as part of the FY 2017 Mathematical Sciences Postdoctoral Research Fellowships Program. Each of the fellowships supports a research and training project at a host institution in the mathematical sciences, including applications to other disciplines, under the mentorship of a sponsoring scientist. The title of the project for this fellowship to Nate Harman is "Stable Representation Theory." The host institution for the fellowship is the University of Chicago, and the sponsoring scientist is Benson Farb.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences

por.por_cntn:
This was a postdoctoral fellowship meant to provide financial support to reduce my teaching load and allow me to focus on research during the first few years after my PhD.   I spent those years at the University of Chicago, with Benson Farb as my faculty mentor.  I worked on a number of projects during that time on a number of topics within representation theory including: representation stability, combinatorial representation theory, representations of arithmetic groups, tensor categories, and modular representations of finite groups of Lie type. During that time I wrote several papers, some alone and some with coauthors, as well as an appendix to a paper by some colleagues.  Due to the variety of different topics and projects I work on, as well as the technical nature of the subject I won't try to summarize my results here. I will note though that all of my papers, both those already published and those still in the publishing process, are available publicly for free on arxiv.org.

Additionally during that time I attended and spoke at various workshops and conferences, taught several courses at the University of Chicago, and was heavily involved with math enrichment education through the organizations MathILy and the Math Circles of Chicago.


Last Modified: 10/26/2021
Modified by: Nate Harman
